No one would have been more astonished than the three youths met in Alva Street that they should be expected to talk in such a style, and they were fair average specimens of the academic youth. I am afraid they would have replied that such impromptu epigrams and so liberal a sprinkling of Attic salt as seasons some recorded students' dialogues are not relished—out of novels!

title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: In the comfortably furnished sitting-room of a well-known boarding-house in Alva Street sat three young men, discussing over a glass of " Glenlivet" and innumerable pipes of " bird'seye " and Latakia, the events of the College session just closed. They were all about the same age—namely, twenty-two—were all classmates, and finally were all contemplating the pursuit of the same profession—the law.

title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: What did it matter if the strains poured forth from a trio of young and lusty throats diffused widespread consternation among the decorous denizens of Alva Street? What did it matter if it abruptly summoned Miss Tabitha Shankspindle, a spinster of uncertain summers, to say nothing of temper, from her virtuous couch in the adjoining house, under the impression that her everlasting apprehension—the igniting of her kitchen chimney—had overtaken her at last?

title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: What did it matter if it abruptly summoned Miss Tabitha Shankspindle, a spinster of uncertain summers, to say nothing of temper, from her virtuous couch in the adjoining house, under the impression that her everlasting apprehension—the igniting of her kitchen chimney—had overtaken her at last? What signified it, also, if Major Macrackitpate, late of the Bengal First Jungle Fencibles—a planter by calling, a soldier by courtesy—who slept in the flat below, and who likewise had been aroused by the chorus, conceiving that the savage Ranipuris of the hids had come down in force to sack his station, at once barricaded his bedroom door, and retired below the bed to await developments ? Such little surface ripples on the stagnant pool of Alva Street society soon subsided, upon the consideration of the fact that " it was juist thae student lads amusin' themselves, puh callants ! "
